title: TERA NOVA font ID
content:
thank you for your help.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828053618im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/tera_4319.jpg)

 [‹ Oriental unknown](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828053618/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46129 "Go to previous forum topic") [Milton Glaser's Bob Dylan poster ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828053618/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46124 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jasonf

comments.content:
I can’t seem to find one font that matches both the R and the O. (The A is probably just an inverted V.) My best suggestion involves two fonts: [Alternate Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828053618/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/alternate-gothic/) for the letters except for the O, and then something like Chank’s [Nicotine](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828053618/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/nicotine/) for the O. I picked that because it was one of the cheaper fonts I could find with that O shape.

- Mike Yanega

Let’s say it is an outlined [Alien League](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828053618/http:/www.dafont.com/font.php?file=alien_league&page=1&nb_ppp_old=10&text=tera+nova&nb_ppp=10&psize=m&classt=alpha) in lowercase without flipping the A’s ;^D

Hmmm. Should have guessed it would be a freebie. Nice spot Renko.

- Mike Yanega
